definition: to pay a visit/to call on
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: After making his tea, I asked if it would be all right if I visited him again .
sentences.chinese: 给他泡好茶之后，我问他以后是否可以再来拜访。

sentences.english: I called on Mr. Lee yesterday.
The boss in whose company Mr. Kang worked called at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 老板到医院拜访了康先生，康先生在他的公司里工作。

sentences.english: Once a year, go some place you've never been before.
sentences.chinese: 每年拜访一个您未从踏足过的地方。

sentences.english: For good luck before taking a test, students may visit a shrine of the Learning god.
sentences.chinese: 考试前求好运，学生可以拜访文昌帝君圣祠。

sentences.english: Mr Ball has just called on Ms Zhu to give her a message.
sentences.chinese: 鲍尔先生刚刚来拜访朱女士，带给她一个口信。

sentences.english: One holiday afternoon his cousin Fred came to pay him a visit.
sentences.chinese: 一个假日的下午，他的堂哥福瑞德拜访他。

sentences.english: My friend, Marlene, is coming to town for a visit.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友马倰要来镇上拜访。

sentences.english: Jo told the others about her visit to the newspaperman.
sentences.chinese: 乔向大家叙说她拜访报社一事。

sentences.english: He's here on a visit from Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 他是专程从广州到这里来拜访的。

sentences.english: I just got here from America yesterday and I have an appointment with Manager Zhang, I plan to come and see him.
sentences.chinese: 昨天刚从美国来，我跟张经理约了，要去公司拜访他。

sentences.english: He decided to call on a famous doctor who lived in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 他决定去拜访住在加拿大的一位著名的医生。
蚊子和老鼠来拜访他们。

sentences.english: Drop in during TA office hours.
The king desired to visit it, and ordered the attendants to drive up to the gates.
sentences.chinese: 他非常想去拜访一下，就令随从驾车来到了大门。

sentences.english: The next day, Ed visited a famous statesman who was respected by people.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，爱德拜访了一位著名的人民爱戴的政治家。

definition: pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to visit/to pay a call to
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
to receive (a visitor)/to admit (allow sb to enter)
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
